name: Steven

Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Overall, cozy is a great description for Connie's place! In addition to the coziness, the kitchen is extremely well-stocked with cooking implements, coffee maker, etc. One of the reasons we choose Airbnb's is for their kitchens and the ability to cook meals. Connie's place has everything we needed to use - the oven, the stove top, big refrigerator.
The bathroom sink area is snug but the shower stall is a nice size - and the place has lots and lots of really hot water with excellent water pressure! There is a step up into the bathroom so if you're like us you'll trip once. Plenty of room for two people to spread out and take advantage of the provided wifi and Roku television setup.
Only drawbacks we noted were due to winter more so than the property. Parking access gets crowded by the snow banks; the metal roof has a tendency to release built-up snow right onto the walkway to the unit.

We were there for homecoming/alumni events at LSSU so we were only about two minutes away. There are stairs to reach the unit, so if that is an issue for you, it wonâ€™t be a good fit. review_text:
Connie's place is very nice and exactly as described, only better! It's easy to find, with off-street parking and a good location. Keyless entry! Easy on and off the freeway. It's a nice walk down to the waterfront, past many interesting storefronts. You can walk to your choice of many restaurants. You're close to the area attractions.
The apartment itself was extremely comfortable and well-appointed; it has a fabulous kitchen with every implement you might need. I did not cook during my stay, but it would be really nice for a family because eating out every day and night can get expensive. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets and towels were of high quality. The bathroom has a nice showerhead and lots of hot water. Watch that small step up into the bathroom, though!
After exploring the area all day it was nice to come home to such a cozy retreat. Relax. Watch a movie. There were many small, thoughtful touches that made this stay a real winner.
I would definitely recommend staying here.

review_text: Wow, what an amazing gem in beautiful historic downtown Sault Ste. Marie !!! The almost secret and harmoniously poetic â€œspeakeasyâ€ style entry nailed the vibe from the moment you arrive and walk through the Palace restaurant belowâ€™s main entry door. From there it feels even more adventurous as you open the adjacent beautiful solid wood bi-fold closet-style door with a small sign noting the ABNB access point. You will then climb a set of traditionally historic wooden stairs, which are tolerable, yet allows you enough exercise that it creates a prelude heat beat in preparation for the amazing view you find immediately upon arriving at your destination. Atop this flight you will find your entry â€”â€”â€” a large solid wood door with a polished brass key code style lock â€”â€”- from there, prepare yourself, as you swing this door open you are met by an amazing view over the world famous Soo locks with the backdrop of the country of Canada. An all glass wall leaves nothing to hide. I will be back !!!

review_text: Convenient location. Onsite parking OK for mid-size car. Bigger vehicles may be a problem onsite. The two flights of stairs (no elevator) will give you a workout. Short walk to everything. The window is very nice for viewing boat traffic, but not the locks because of trees in the adjacent park. Very nice park. Spacious interior. Neighborhood noise is what I expected in advance. The property is in a commercial, downtown tourist area next to a working maritime installation under construction. Occasional loud vehicles on the main drag at night. Could hear downstair tenantâ€™s TV at night. Loud riding lawn mower on adjacent lot before 7:30 am. All 3 bedrooms had double beds. 2 of the 3 bedrooms could easily accommodate bigger beds. Bathroom clean and basic. Notified owner of 2 bath issues. A sharp protrusion on the bathâ€™s hot water knob resulted in a minor cut. The bathâ€™s grab bar was not secure. The owner was apologetic and quick to respond. Would stay again after bath issues repaired.

review_text:
Beautiful view of the locks, spacious and clean apartment. Walk up above restaurant as advertised. It closes at ten so you will have a quiet night. We really enjoyed this space, plenty of room for sister, her kids and our father to enjoy. Working pump organ was a fun extra. Extended family and some friends came to tour the place when we told them about it and were impressed as well.
Good food at the palace saloon and easy take out. Just down the block is Birdseye outfitters, they offer great paddle tours and healthy food and smoothies, good coffee.
Note that the parking spot only works with a compact car. Close free parking nearby in a lot or paid parking at the hospital ramp. Some issues with a beeping smoke alarm which disrupted our sleep, the host eventually addressed and did make this right. Just be sure you are communicating with the main host asap if any urgent issues come up, especially in the evening.
Would stay here again when we are in the area.

review_text:
A (very well) hidden gem in downtown Sault Ste Marie!
The apartment is accessed via a closet-like folding door in the vestibule of the Palace Mexican restaurant. Up a couple of flights of stairs is a BEAUTIFUL loft-type space that is much bigger than it looks in the listing pictures. It has a cozy living room, fully stocked kitchen, spacious dining area, three bedrooms, and a large bathroom with full-size washer and dryer. Donâ€™t forget the wall-to-wall window with a view of the river!
The location couldnâ€™t be better. We were basically smack in the middle of downtown Sault Ste Marie, with great restaurants and museums in walking distance either direction out our front door. A short (less than a block) walk got us to the park at the locks to watch the freighters go between Lake Huron and Lake Superior.
Our only issue was with parking. Thanks to some messaging with our hosts, we found out that you do, in fact, park next to the â€œNo Parkingâ€ sign, on top of the â€œNo Parkingâ€ painted on the ground.
Overall, it was a great space in a perfect location that will be our first choice for our next trip to Sault Ste Marie!

review_text: The space is the third floor of a 100-year old building, above a Mexican restaurant. You do have to be able to haul yourself, your luggage, and your children up two flights of stairs, but the space and view are so worth it. The space is thoughtfully remodeled, keeping the older charm. Lots of room to spread out and unwind. Everything was immaculately clean. Washer & dryer were great and the kitchen well-stocked and table big enough for a feast! Of course we enjoyed watching the huge boats enter and leave the docks from the window that stretches along the entire wall facing the water. Summertime's leafy trees blocked the view a bit, but still able to watch them come and go. This is also on the mainstrip, walkable to cafes, restaurants, gift shops, and the park with museum & deck to watch the locks. Highly recommend!

review_text: We were looking for a pet friendly place in the Soo area, visiting relatives in Brimley. Accommodations were extremely tight due to the construction work going on at the Soo Locks. We found this neat old motel on Air BnB and it was pet friendly and reasonably priced. The rooms looked good and it had what we needed, so we reserved it. When we arrived, I followed the instructions and was able to get in with no problems. There are just two small steps up to the door and they are shallow enough that I had no trouble with them. The rooms are small but big enough to fit us comfortably. The bed was so comfortable we slept very well. The decor fits nicely with the retro look. There was nothing wrong anywhere in the place and we wish we could have spent more time there. Next time we come to the Soo, we'll stay there again.

Group trip
review_text:
I brought a group of my college students up for a documentary project and Scott's place was PERFECT. We were running around the EUP every day, but this peaceful cabin was the perfect place to stop in for lunch and for quick naps before we went on with our day.
At night, it was the perfect place for us to relax and hang out. My students loved the fire pit and the cozy accomodations, especially when the Northern lights were out during our first night! (Thanks for the heads up Scott!)
As for Scott, he was extremely communicative and helpful and has set up one of the most well-prepared vacation homes I've ever been to. The cabin had all of the basics, but had some great quality of life things stocked up (firewood, camp chairs, etc.) that made our trip easy and fun.

We hiked the trails on the property. We had a bonfire & played corn hole (provided by host). The place was very clean & inviting with firewood & chairs provided. We also played board games that were provided. My adult children drove to whitefish point at night to rock hunt & found some yooper lights. On the way home we checked out the state park in Brimley which was very nice also. I like the close proximity of everything to this air bnb. The kitchen was very well stocked. We didnâ€™t lack any tools to make our meals. Would recommend this 10/10 & would love to return one day. It is truly a place of nature & solitude & you leave feeling mentally rested & relaxed.

review_text:
Scott's cabin was immaculate. The photos and description don't do it justice - perfect for our family getaway. It is obviously well maintained, clean, well supplied with games and movies, kitchen utensils, shampoo/soaps etc.
Only 20 minutes from the Soo and 45 from Mackinac ferries, the location for us was ideal.
We had a small issue with a slow draining sink and Scott was responsive within 20 minutes offering to have a plumber come out or reimburse us for some draino. Exactly the response you'd want from a host.
Our kids did great in the bunk room. One note if you travel with an infant- there is no room in the bedroom for a pack-n-play. You could fit a narrow bassinet between the bed and the wall, or put a pack-n-play in the bunk room (or large linen closet next to the bedroom..who are we to judge ğŸ˜‰).
We had to cut our trip a day short, but we will be back to visit again in the future. Scott's cabin will be our new home base on the east side of the UP.

name: Brian
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Scott texted us on our check-in date to let us know the cleaning crew had done their thing, the house was ready for us and made sure we had the passcode to the door and contact info in case we had any issues with it.
We arrived later than we expected because we left later than expected so it was dark when we arrived. Our Garmin GPS was off on the address by about 500 feet, Apple and Google Maps are spot on by the way. Everything began to get better as soon as we pulled in to the driveway.
There are motion activated outdoor lights so if you arrive in the dark like we did you'll have plenty of lighting to navigate the unfamiliar terrain. The keypad to unlock the door was easy enough to use so we didn't have any issue with that.
You walk into a breezeway or mudroom with plenty of hooks to hand up everyone's jackets, shelves for your hats and gloves and mats for your boots. There is also a washer and dryer in this room and a washtub to wash off your boots when you get mud on them. We didn't use the washtub but it's nice to know it was there.
There is an insulated door that separates the mudroom from the rest of the house which takes you to the kitchen. The kitchen table has enough chairs to seat 8 people. Everything in the kitchen was very clean. The refrigerator was empty but cool, ready for food. The electric stove was nice. There were labels on kitchen shelves which helps to remember were things go back if you use them all up, say drinking glasses for instance.
The living room has two couches and two recliner chairs along with a TV with DirecTV and a DVD player. There was a nice selection of DVD's and books. And what our kids thought was the best part, the wood stove. Thankfully wood for the stove is provided and is easily accessible from an insulated door in the living room. This is a vestibule that contains just the wood for the stove and has another door leading to the outside.
There is one bedroom with 8 bunkbeds which are much larger than I imagined. All of our kinds are late teens, early 20's except for one so they are pretty big. They all thought they were comfortable.
The master bedroom has a comfy queen sized bed with a cozy comforter. All of the beds had sheets and blankets and were ready for someone to just hop in.
The bathroom... well, what can I say? It has a sink a toilet and a shower. :)
Oh, and almost forgot to mention the whole place is wood, the floors and and the walls. Absolutely spectacular.
The view out all the windows is nothing but woods with occasional wildlife so if you get tired of admiring the beauty of this house then just look out the window.
This house is more than just a place to hang your hat in the evening, it adds to the vacation and will be pretty high in the things we talk about.

name: Cynthia
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2019
,
Â·
Group trip
review_text:
If you're looking for a place to relax and explore, book this cabin! It's 180 acres of your own to enjoy, but "Cozy Corners" is less than 5 minutes away for dinner and drinks. There are grocery options in different directions, around a 15-20 minute drive.
The cabin was SPOTLESS. It was fully stocked with clean towels, sheets, blankets, bathroom amenities, kitchen essentials, a coffee bar, games/movies. The bunk beds were great and VERY comfortable. Three adults used the bunk room and were surprised how private each bed felt. We didn't expect the mattresses to be comfortable, but we were all very pleased and woke up refreshed.
It has so many extras, too- you really feel at home. The only thing I wish I'd brought was a travel mug of my own, since we decided to take some daily excursions. Honestly, we didn't need/want anything extra- just our own clothes and groceries.
The owners are great at communicating before and during the stay, and the smart lock is very easy to use.
Make an outdoor fire, some s'mores, and take in the stars at the cabin. If you enjoy hiking, enjoy their trails.
While staying, consider taking some drives. Canada was only 30 minutes away. PLEASE visit the Breakfast Pig for brunch and the Queen's Tarts for a treat to take home. Thompson's Strawberry Farm is adorable and a MUST for wine tasters. The SOO Locks were interesting to see for the water and history lovers.
About an hour and a half East- Oswald's Bear Ranch is home to 39 very happy bears. Bonus, you can feed them apples and take a picture with a cub! We combined this with an additional 30 minute drive North to Tahquamenon Falls. The Upper Falls were so impressive and humbling. The falls are handicapped accessible, but also allow for many hiking trails. We stopped for views of Lake Superior on the drive back to the cabin.
Macinac City and Island are a fun experience- about 45 minutes south of the cabin.
On our way back to the land of the Trolls (ha!), we stopped by Bronner's for all things Christmas and the Bavarian Inn for a Chicken Dinner in Frankenmuth.
A giant thank you to the owners of the cabin. This vacation was very special for my family, and we will never forget our memories and how you played a role.

If you just want to relax then sit outside around a campfire making sâ€™mores while enjoying some corn hole or ladder golf, or take in the sounds of nature and the fresh smell of the northern air. The girls loved having us all stay in the bunk room, and were very happy there was a private bedroom so grandma and grandpa could join us for the last couple of days. All linens were provided and having a washer and dryer were a huge bonus.
The communication was very prompt and the host provided exceptional local information. We are looking forward to another trip and hope this cabin is available when booking.

We stayed here with 6 people - including a 2 and 6 year old, and had plenty of room to relax and comfortably sleep. The bunk room is awesome and the great room is super well furnished. We don't typically do a lot of camping, (and staying here really isn't hardcore camping), but it was a great mix of comfort and cabin-life for us. Scott had very attentive and well prepared communication with us and we're already planning our next trip to come back here!

And the steps to the second floor apartment are on the outside and they are metal with a large grate. We brought our two dogs that really struggled going up and down the stairs. Their feet would get caught in the holes and we had to carry them most of the time and they are not small and donâ€™t love being picked up. review_text: If you're going to the Soo stop looking for places to stay and book this loft! The hosts are fantastic, the space is beautiful and SPOTLESS. You stay right above a great restaurant/bar which can fill your bellies with food and spirits, the entire town is walkable and awesome to see the history of the area. Small shops and restaurants are unique and well done, the scenery is beautiful and there's a lot to do if you have kids with you. Hockey families this is your perfect tournament home base, less than ten minutes from all the rinks in the Soo and very comfortable for a between game nap, laundry to keep those sweaters fresh for the next game. My wife loved the decor and hand touches the hosts added to the unit you feel as you are staying at a family members house we loved everything about it!

review_text:
What a lovely place to stay in the Soo! Our family has stayed in many different places over the years in this area, but this was a step above all the others. It was clean and very beautifully decorated. One thing that I appreciated very much was the attention to the small details. The hosts do not skimp on the nice toilet paper, laundry detergent, towels or soaps. I felt cared for and valued by these things! The kitchen is stocked with all the important things so this place is nice for a longer stay. There is a Roku and Apple TV which was convenient as well.
This place is conveniently located beside The Wicked Sister restaurant, which we took advantage of a few times! We also really enjoyed the location in town. We walked to the locks several times.
Danna and Terry were very kind and we were happy to meet them! We highly recommend staying here!

It isnâ€™t clear from the description, but this is an entire house. There is a downstairs bedroom with bunk beds, an upstairs bedroom with two queens, and a small foldable bed that can be moved where you want it. There is a small living room, two bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, and laundry in the basement.
Itâ€™s not the best neighborhood and the house is a bit worn, but it is very much nicer than having to squeeze into a double room with three kids. Pet-friendly also, so we didnâ€™t have to kennel the dog.
Having a full sized fridge was nice. We could refreeze our cooler packs and store breakfast items so we didnâ€™t have to eat out the whole time. Our first Airbnb experience was positive!
